Sentencas: The Laves phase strengthened ferritic steel Crofer 22 H has recently been proposed as construction material for interconnects in solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs).
Titulo: Mechanisms of Oxide Scale Formation on Ferritic Interconnect Steel in Simulated Low and High pO2 Service Environments of Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: In the present study, the oxidation kinetics of Crofer 22 H at 800 A degrees C was compared with that of a Mn-free batch during exposure in air and Ar-H-2-H2O, the latter simulating the anode gas of a SOFC.
Titulo: Mechanisms of Oxide Scale Formation on Ferritic Interconnect Steel in Simulated Low and High pO2 Service Environments of Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: Main emphasis was put on studying the oxidation mechanisms of Crofer 22 H during the early stages of isothermal reaction as well as during long-term discontinuous exposure.
Titulo: Mechanisms of Oxide Scale Formation on Ferritic Interconnect Steel in Simulated Low and High pO2 Service Environments of Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: Differences in oxidation mechanisms in air and simulated anode gas (SAG) were defined.
Titulo: Mechanisms of Oxide Scale Formation on Ferritic Interconnect Steel in Simulated Low and High pO2 Service Environments of Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: Oxidation rates for Crofer 22 H in air were found to be initially slower than in SAG, but the opposite effect was observed after longer exposure times.
Titulo: Mechanisms of Oxide Scale Formation on Ferritic Interconnect Steel in Simulated Low and High pO2 Service Environments of Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: This effect of atmosphere composition on the oxidation rate is shown to be governed by the time dependent extent to which the inner chromia scale layer is covered by an outer Cr/Mn spinel layer.
Titulo: Mechanisms of Oxide Scale Formation on Ferritic Interconnect Steel in Simulated Low and High pO2 Service Environments of Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: In both test gases the minor addition of silicon to Crofer 22 H resulted in internal silica formation during the very early stages of oxidation; this effect vanished after longer exposure times.
Titulo: Mechanisms of Oxide Scale Formation on Ferritic Interconnect Steel in Simulated Low and High pO2 Service Environments of Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: Incorporation of titanium in the scale differed for the two test atmospheres because the oxygen partial pressure affects titanium solubility in chromia and especially the spinel phase.
Titulo: Mechanisms of Oxide Scale Formation on Ferritic Interconnect Steel in Simulated Low and High pO2 Service Environments of Solid Oxide Fuel Cells
